meals.name: Baked Eggs in Avocado
meals.instruction:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
2. Slice the avocado in half and scoop out a little flesh from
each to make room for the eggs. Place face-up on a baking
sheet.
3. Crack an egg into each half and bake for 10-15 minutes,
depending on how runny you like your eggs.

Smoothie

meals.name:
Mozzarella Pesto Panini
with Basil
meals.instruction:
If your bun is large, use only one halve by cutting
it in half to make a small sandwich.
Spread pesto on both sides of bun and lay the
mozzarella on both halves.
Place whole basil leaves and tomato slices on one
half of the bun and top with the other half of the bun
(tomato and basil should be sandwiched between
mozzarella).
Use a panini press to grill the sandwich for 2-3
minutes until cheese melts (see "Notes" below).

meals.name: Chocolate Dream Smoothie
meals.instruction:
In a high speed blender, add all ingredients in the order
listed. Blend on high speed for one minute.
Add water or ice, if needed, to reach your desired thickness.
Note:
Cacao vs. Cocoa � What�s the difference?
Raw cacao is superior to cocoa powder because it is made
by cold-pressing un-roasted cocoa beans. It is an excellent
source of essential fatty acids, fiber, magnesium, zinc, iron
and calcium.
Cocoa powder is made from cocoa beans that have been
roasted at high temperatures.
If you can�t find cacao, buy unprocessed, non-alkalized
cocoa powder.

ingredients.name:
Pork chop, loin centre cut, bone-in, lean
((3/4 inch) thick; room temperature)

Red bell pepper ( seeded and cut into

meals.name: Pork Chops and Peppers
meals.instruction:
Sprinkle the chops on both sides with the salt and
pepper.

Heat the olive oil in a heavy skillet over medium-
high heat and add the chops, onion, and garlic.

Cook the chops for 5 minutes on one side, shaking
the pan frequently so garlic doesn't burn, then turn
chops and add the pepper strips.
Cover and cook 5 to 8 minutes longer or until the
pork registers at least 145�F.
Remove the chops, onions, garlic, and the peppers
from the skillet and set aside, covered to keep
warm.
Add the Worcestershire sauce, water or chicken
broth, thyme, and marjoram to the drippings
remaining in the skillet, scraping the bottom of the
skillet with a rubber spatula to loosen the pan
drippings that contain lots of flavors.
Cook until the sauce thickens slightly, then return
the pork and vegetables to the skillet.
Cook for 1 minute longer to coat the pork with the
sauce, then serve.

meals.name: Basil Pesto Tuna Salad
meals.instruction:
Drain can of tuna and flake in a bowl.
Add pesto, green onion tops, capers, lemon juice
then stir to combine.
Season to taste with salt and pepper
Instructions for "Low-FODMAP Basil
Pesto"
Toast pine nuts in a small skillet over low heat,
stirring frequently and taking care not to burn (see
picture below). Cool to room temperature.
Add basil, garlic-infused olive oil, cheese, pine nuts,
and a few turns of freshly ground black pepper to
the food processor or blender. Blend until smooth.
Taste and adjust seasonings as necessary.
Transfer pesto to a container and if not using it
immediately, squeeze fresh lemon juice on top.
Lemon juice acts as a natural preservative to keep
the pesto bright green.

Red chili pepper (also chile or chilli)

meals.name: Steamed Garlicy Rapini
meals.instruction:
1. Steam the rapini in a metal steamer under a rolling boil
with the lid on top for no more than 4 minutes (crunchiness
is key).
2. In the mean time, slice the pepper and crush the garlic.
3. When the rapini is cooked yet still crunchy, strain out the
water and add rapini to the empty pot.
4. Over medium heat add the oil, garlic, pepper and salt.
Saute for 1-2 minutes.
5. Remove from heat and add the apple cider vinegar. Stir
to mix well and serve hot.

meals.name:
Smashed Chickpea,
Avocado & Pesto Salad
Sandwich
meals.instruction:
1. Place the chickpeas on a paper towel or clean kitchen
towel and remove the outer skins. Roll them around a bit
and they will come off easily. This step is optional.
2. In a medium bowl, combine the chickpeas and avocado.
Smash with a fork until well combined. It is all right if some
of the chickpeas are chunky, this will give the mixture
texture.

3. Stir in pesto and fresh lemon juice. Season with salt and
pepper, to taste.
4. Spread chickpea salad on bread slices and top with
spinach leaves, if using. Cut sandwich in half and serve!
5. Serve with cut up veggies, crackers, or pita chips. Enjoy!

Fry in a pan with a little oil or butter on low to
medium heat.
Flip with a spatula once bubbles start to appear.
Cook until both sides are golden brown.

meals.name:
Creamy Vegan Carbonara
with Shiitake Bacon
meals.instruction:
To Make the Shiitake Bacon
Preheat oven to 350�F.
Line a baking pan with parchment paper.
In a bowl, add the shiitakes, olive oil, sea salt, liquid smoke and black pepper to the pan. Toss to thoroughly coat. Transfer to
baking pan.
Bake for 20-30 minutes, turning and flipping every so often (5-8 min) until golden brown and crispy.
Remove from oven and transfer the shiitake bacon to a plate lined with a paper towel. Pat off excess oil and let cool.
To Make the Hemp Parmesan
Add the hemp hearts, nutritional yeast, and sea salt to a food processor. Process for 1-2 minutes and transfer to a small
bowl. Refrigerate until ready to use.
To Make the Carbonara Pasta
Turn the oven up to 400�F.
Add the zucchini, garlic, shallots, and olive oil to a pan. Bake for 30 minutes, flipping halfway through baking.
Add the roasted zucchini mixture to a blender along with the nutritional yeast, almond or rice milk, white wine vinegar,
arrowroot powder, sea salt, black/truffle salt, and black pepper. Blend on high for 1-2 minutes or until smooth.
Pour the mixture into a medium sauce pan over medium-low heat. Whisk continuously for 3-4 minutes until thickened.
Add the cooked linguine to a large serving bowl. Pour the creamy sauce over top and toss to coat (add in pasta water as
needed to loosen the sauce).
Divide between bowls, and top with the hemp seed parmesan, shiitake bacon, and fresh parsley.

meals.name: Berry Smoothie Bowl
meals.instruction:
Blend all smoothie ingredients together.

meals.name:
Butternut Squash Ramen
Bowl
meals.instruction:
Combine the squash, broth, salt, garlic and soy
sauce in a medium pot, and stir to mix well until
bubbling and hot (basically to a light boil), about 3-4
minutes.
While the broth is heating up, cube the fresh tofu
into one-inch pieces or a little smaller, as per your
preference. Slice the green onion, and wash and trim
the pea shoots, removing the tough stems.
Take the strand of dry rice noodles, and with your
hands, snap them in half to shorten to noodle
strands, and place them in a generously sized
serving bowl of your choice.
When the broth has reached a bubbling boil, remove
it from the heat and pour all of it over the rice
noodles directly into the serving bowl. Using a fork
and a quick, firm hand, push any errant noodle
strands under the broth to submerge any loose
pieces. Cover the bowl immediately with a small
plate, and set your timer for 6 minutes.
When the 6 minutes is up, remove the plate from
the bowl and stir the noodles to break them up a
little. To serve, push the noodles over to the side a
little, making room for the tofu, scallions & pea
shoots which can be arranged directly into the broth
as you like. Place a little Sambal Oelek in the center
of the bowl, and finish by pouring the toasted
sesame oil into the bowl along with the black
sesame seeds to garnish.
Serve right away with chopsticks or a fork.

meals.name:
Instant Pot Ground Beef
Chili
meals.instruction:
Press the saut� button on the Instant Pot and wait for the metal insert to heat up. Once the insert is hot, add 1 tablespoon of
fat and swirl it around.
As soon as the oil is shimmering, add the onions and bell peppers with a sprinkle of salt.
Cook for 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until the vegetables are softened.
Stir in the tomato paste and minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add in the ground beef, along with 1 teaspoon kosher salt. Brown the meat and break it up with a spatula.
When most of the ground beef is no longer pink (5 to 7 minutes), stir in the chili powder, oregano, cumin, and cayenne
pepper (optional). Combine well to distribute the fragrant spices.
Toss in the drained diced tomatoes, broth, and fish sauce. Stir everything well, making sure the liquid reaches the bottom of
the insert.
Lock the lid and cook under high pressure for 15 minutes. (In other words, press the �Manual� or �Pressure Cook� button and
set the time for 15 minutes under high pressure.)
When the chili is finished cooking, release the pressure manually if you�re itching to eat it right away. Otherwise, you can let
the pressure come down naturally and chow down when you�re ready.
Taste the chili and adjust the seasoning if necessary. Sprinkle on some extra salt and stir in the apple cider vinegar, if
desired. Taste again to see if you need to punch up the flavors.
Ladle up the chili and serve with your favorite toppings, like sliced avocado, white onion, and cilantro!
You can store the chili in the fridge for up to 4 days in the fridge or up to 6 months in the freezer.

meals.name: Stovetop Popcorn
meals.instruction:
Add the oil and one kernel to a small sauce pot. Place the lid
on top and turn the heat onto high. Wait for the kernel to
pop.
Once the kernel has popped, add the rest of the kernels,
replace the lid, and give the pot a swirl to coat the kernels
in the hot oil. Wait for the kernels to begin to pop. You can
swirl again to redistribute the hot oil, if needed.
Once the kernels begin to pop rapidly, crack the lid a little
bit to allow excess steam to escape. Make sure it it only
open a little to keep the pot hot enough to continue popping
the corn.
When the popping slows to a few seconds between pops,
turn off the heat. Wait a few extra seconds for the last few
pops, then remove the lid and season the popcorn.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Vegetable Kabobs
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 400�F.
In a very large bowl, whisk together olive oil, garlic,
lemon juice, oregano and basil; season with salt and
pepper, to taste.
Toss vegetables in and mix well to cover all the
pieces (see "Notes" below).
Thread mushrooms, tomatoes, bell peppers, onion
and zucchini onto skewers. Place skewers onto a
baking sheet. Pour any remaining dressing over the
skewers.
Place into oven and roast until tender, about 10-12
minutes. Serve immediately.

meals.name:
Chopped Taco Mason Jar
Salad
meals.instruction:
In a medium pan cook ground turkey until no longer pink.
Add black beans, seasoning packet, and the amount of
water stated in seasoning packet directions. Let taco
mixture cool.
Divide ingredients among 5 mason jars starting with salsa
then adding greek yogurt, tomatoes, cucumbers, onions,
jalape�os, avocados, taco meat, then lettuce. Place lid on
and close tight. No need to vacuum seal or anything like
that.
When ready to eat, shake real good, then pour into a bowl
and enjoy. Can serve with tortilla chips.

meals.name: Tomato Chickpea Soup
meals.instruction:
Warm the olive oil in a large heavy-bottomed pot set over
high heat and add the onions. Stir and turn heat down to
medium after 1 minute. Let onions cook, stirring
occasionally, for 5 minutes. Add the minced garlic and
rosemary. Cook for a minute or two, and then add the
tomatoes, honey, salt, pepper, 1 can chickpeas, and the
stock. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to
low and simmer, covered, for 30 minutes.
Turn off heat and let cool slightly. Working in batches, pur�e
soup in blender and return to pot. Add the remaining can of
chickpeas and warm the soup to serve.

meals.name: Baked Eggs in Avocado
meals.instruction:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
2. Slice the avocado in half and scoop out a little flesh from
each to make room for the eggs. Place face-up on a baking
sheet.
3. Crack an egg into each half and bake for 10-15 minutes,
depending on how runny you like your eggs.

meals.name:
Spicy Cilantro Shrimp with
Honey Lime Dip
meals.instruction:
Combine the paprika, salt, cumin, cayenne, and
cinnamon in a large bowl. Add the shrimp and toss
to fully coat the shrimp in seasoning.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-high
heat. Add the shrimp and cook about 2 minutes on
each side. You�ll know the shrimp is done when it
turns pink and curls into a �C� shape.
Toss the shrimp with fresh lime juice and cilantro
and serve with dipping sauce,
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Greek yogurt, plain, 2%
M.F. 1/2 cup
Instructions:
Mix all the ingredients and chill until ready to serve
with Spicy Cilantro Shrimp.

meals.name: Lean & Green Tofu Stir-Fry
meals.instruction:
Spray a non-stick skillet with cooking spray and heat
over medium heat. Add onion and mushrooms and
saute until onions are translucent and mushrooms
have softened (about 2-3 minutes).
Add the green pepper, rapini, and edamame and
saute for 3-4 minutes.
Now add tofu and garlic to the skillet. Toss to
combine and cook for 1-2 minutes more.
Add your oyster sauce, soy sauce, and nutritional
yeast to the pan. Stir until everything is well coated.
Add spinach and tomatoes. Cook for 2-3 minutes
longer until spinach starts to wilt slightly. Top with
sriracha and chopped peanuts. Enjoy!

Cruciferous Salad with
Asian Sesame Dressing
meals.instruction:
Cook barley according to package instructions.
In a bowl combine dressing ingredients.
Place the salad mix in a large bowl and add the dressing.
Massage the dressing in with your hands to tenderize, about
2 minutes. Add carrots, zucchini, and almonds.
Portion greens into 4 mason jars. Add barley.
Tip: The morning of add protein of choice � tofu, chicken,
steak, etc.

Salad
meals.instruction:
To make the salad:
Stir the parsley, mint, tomatoes, cucumber, and beans
together in a medium bowl. In a small bowl, whisk together
the lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper until it is thick
and creamy. Pour the dressing over the beans and toss to
combine.
Divide the baby greens among 4 plates and top with the
beans. Flake the salmon over the top, and serve drizzled
with the yogurt dressing.

Instructions:

minced garlic, lemon zest and juice, mint, salt,
pepper, and 1 tablespoon water (more or less
depending on preferred consistency). Set aside.

Roll up the wrap and Enjoy!

meals.name:
Broccoli Cashew Stir-Fry
With Brown Rice
meals.instruction:
1. Cook rice as directed on packaging.
2. In a small bowl, mix together all ingredients for the
sauce. Set aside.
3. Heat a large fry pan or wok over medium-high heat. Add
cashews and roast for 2 to 3 minutes. Stirring frequently.
Careful not to burn them. Set aside with the green parts of
the green onion.
4. In the same pan, add the sesame oil and heat over
medium-high heat. Add the white parts of the green onion,
broccoli and mushrooms. Saut� for about 5 minutes or until
broccoli is starting to become tender. Add 3-6 tablespoons
of water, if needed, to stop browning or burning.
5. Add the snow peas and bok choy and saut� for 2
minutes.
6. Add the sauce and saut� for about 3 to 5 minutes or until
the sauce thickens. Remove from heat and add in the
cashews and green parts of the green onion.
7. Serve immediately with brown rice.

ingredients.name:
Egg (cracked and beaten; can sub with

egg whites)

Almond milk, unsweetened (can sub

meals.name: Simple Breakfast Taco
meals.instruction:
Spray a bowl or mug with cooking spray. Add the
spinach and microwave for 30 seconds.
Remove from the microwave and add the eggs and
milk or water, stir. Season with salt, pepper, and any
other spices. Microwave for 1.5-2 minutes until fluffy.
Add the egg mixture to the tortillas and top with
cheese and salsa. Enjoy!

meals.name: Garlic Parmesan Roasted Potatoes
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 400�F. Lightly oil a baking sheet or
coat with nonstick spray.
Place potatoes in a single layer onto the prepared
baking sheet. Add olive oil, garlic, thyme, oregano,
basil, and Parmesan; season with salt and pepper, to
taste. Gently toss to combine.
Place into oven and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until
golden brown and crisp. Stir in butter until melted,
about 1 minute.
Serve immediately, garnished with parsley.

meals.name: High Protein Salad in a Jar
meals.instruction:
Make dressing by mixing together yoghurt, olive oil, lemon juice, cumin, cinnamon, ginger, crushed garlic clove and chili paste. Add
honey to taste. Season with salt and pepper.
Pour dressing at the bottom of a tall glass jar. Layer on top quinoa, sliced red pepper, tomatoes, lentils. grated carrot, spinach
leaves, seeds, sprouts and chopped mint leaves.
Close tightly and store in the fridge overnight.

meals.name:
Banana Bread Porridge
Bowl
meals.instruction:
Place half the banana in a medium saucepan and
use a wooden spoon to roughly mash it.
Add the almond milk, water, pinch of salt, coconut
sugar, and ground cinnamon to the pan and bring to
a simmer over medium heat.
When the mixture reaches temperature, stir in the
oats and quinoa flakes and cook for 1-2 minutes
(cook longer if you like a thicker oatmeal), stirring
often.
Stir in the vanilla extract and transfer to a bowl.
Slice the remaining banana half and arrange on top
of the oatmeal.
Add the blueberries to the porridge
Garnish with toasted nuts and seeds.

meals.name: Stovetop Popcorn
meals.instruction:
Add the oil and one kernel to a small sauce pot. Place the lid
on top and turn the heat onto high. Wait for the kernel to
pop.
Once the kernel has popped, add the rest of the kernels,
replace the lid, and give the pot a swirl to coat the kernels
in the hot oil. Wait for the kernels to begin to pop. You can
swirl again to redistribute the hot oil, if needed.
Once the kernels begin to pop rapidly, crack the lid a little
bit to allow excess steam to escape. Make sure it it only
open a little to keep the pot hot enough to continue popping
the corn.
When the popping slows to a few seconds between pops,
turn off the heat. Wait a few extra seconds for the last few
pops, then remove the lid and season the popcorn.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Poultry seasoning, Trader's Choice (or

any poultry seasoning)

meals.name: Meatless Meatloaf
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 350�F.
Thoroughly rinse the lentils and remove any
shriveled lentils, debris, or rocks. Transfer the rinsed
lentils to a saucepan and pour in 1 cup water (add a
bayleaf and a garlic clove for flavour if you want, but
DO NOT add salt).
Bring the water to a rapid simmer over medium-high
heat, then reduce the heat to maintain a very gentle
simmer. Cook, uncovered, for 20 to 30 minutes (add
water as needed to make sure the lentils are just
barely covered).
Meanwhile, in a large skillet, saute the onions in
olive oil until softened. Add the bread cubes and
saute for another 3-4 minutes. Remove from heat.
Mix the eggs, veggie burger, seasonings and
cheddar in a large bowl. Add the onion/bread
mixture and mix well. Press firmly into a lightly
greased 2 quart baking dish.
For the topping, whisk the ketchup, brown sugar and
water together in a measuring cup or small bowl.
Pour evenly over the loaf.
Bake uncovered for 45 minutes.

ingredients.name:
Chicken thighs, boneless, skinless (cut

into small pieces)

Chicken broth (stock), low sodium (or

homemade stock)

meals.name:
Nourishing Chicken Noodle
Soup
meals.instruction:
Heat a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Add 1 1/2 teaspoons oil; swirl to coat. Add chicken;
cook 6 minutes or until browned, stirring
occasionally. Remove chicken from pan.
Add remaining 1 tablespoon oil to pan; swirl to coat.
Add leek and carrot; saut� 5 minutes. Add stock and
thyme; bring to a boil. Cover and cook 8 minutes or
until carrot is almost tender.
Stir in chicken, peas, pepper, and salt; cook 3
minutes.
Remove thyme; discard. Remove pan from heat; stir
in lettuce and parsley.

ingredients.name:
Oyster mushroom (chopped into large
pieces; or whatever mushroom you
prefer)

Green bell pepper (chopped into large
pieces)

Rapini, broccoli raab, raw (chopped into

large pieces)

Tofu, regular, extra firm (pressed &
chopped into bite-size cubes)

meals.name: Lean & Green Tofu Stir-Fry
meals.instruction:
Spray a non-stick skillet with cooking spray and heat
over medium heat. Add onion and mushrooms and
saute until onions are translucent and mushrooms
have softened (about 2-3 minutes).
Add the green pepper, rapini, and edamame and
saute for 3-4 minutes.
Now add tofu and garlic to the skillet. Toss to
combine and cook for 1-2 minutes more.
Add your oyster sauce, soy sauce, and nutritional
yeast to the pan. Stir until everything is well coated.
Add spinach and tomatoes. Cook for 2-3 minutes
longer until spinach starts to wilt slightly. Top with
sriracha and chopped peanuts. Enjoy!

meals.name:
Banana Bread Porridge
Bowl
meals.instruction:
Place half the banana in a medium saucepan and
use a wooden spoon to roughly mash it.
Add the almond milk, water, pinch of salt, coconut

Slice the remaining banana half and arrange on top
of the oatmeal.
Add the blueberries to the porridge
Garnish with toasted nuts and seeds.

meals.name:
Cottage Cheese & Fruit
Snack
meals.instruction:
These two ingredients make for the easiest high protein
snack to keep you feeling satisfied between meals.

meals.name: Kale-Hemp Pesto
meals.instruction:
Place kale, hemp seeds, garlic, salt, parmesan, and lemon
juice in a food processor fitted with the blade attachment.
Process until combined, then, with the machine running,
drizzle in olive oil until mixture looks totally smooth. Cover
and store in fridge for up to 5 days.
Note:
Serve with gluten-free pasta.
This recipe makes 1 cup of pesto. 1 cup = 16 tbsp. Serving
size is based on 2 tbsp.

ingredients.name:
Almond milk, unsweetened (or hemp or

coconut)

meals.name: Apple Cinnamon Overnight Oats
meals.instruction:
In a one-pint sized mason jar combine dry ingredients.
Add remaining ingredients and stir well.
Place lid on container and leave on the counter at room
temperature or in the fridge, overnight.
In the morning, eat the goodness. Add more maple syrup if
desired.

ingredients.name:
Oyster mushroom (or any mushroom

you prefer)
Red bell pepper ( cut into chunks)
Green bell pepper ( cut into chunks)

meals.name: Vegetable Kabobs
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 400�F.
In a very large bowl, whisk together olive oil, garlic,
lemon juice, oregano and basil; season with salt and
pepper, to taste.
Toss vegetables in and mix well to cover all the
pieces (see "Notes" below).
Thread mushrooms, tomatoes, bell peppers, onion
and zucchini onto skewers. Place skewers onto a
baking sheet. Pour any remaining dressing over the
skewers.
Place into oven and roast until tender, about 10-12
minutes. Serve immediately.

ingredients.name:
Atlantic salmon, wild (leave whole or
cut into smaller portioned fillets)

meals.name: Pecan Lime Baked Salmon
meals.instruction:
1. Spray a large baking dish with cooking spray and place
salmon in dish. Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
2. Place pecans in food processor and pulse until very finely
chopped. Place in a bowl and mix with brown sugar, lime
juice, dill, and salt and pepper until a paste forms.
3. Rub mixture onto salmon and bake in pre-heated oven for
about 15 minutes.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Whey protein powder, vanilla (or vanilla

protein powder of choice)

meals.name:
Vanilla Almond Protein
Smoothie
meals.instruction:
In a blender, combine water and spinach first. Then add
remaining ingredients. Mix until smooth and enjoy.

meals.name: Shepherds Pie
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 200 degrees.
In a medium pot, add sweet potatoes and cover with water.
Bring to a boil, cover and cook on low for 15 minutes or
until fork tender.
In the meanwhile, preheat large non-stick or cast iron skillet
on medium heat and swirl olive oil to coat.
Add onions and garlic, saute for a few minutes, stirring
occasionally.
Add carrots and cook for a few more minutes.
Add ground meat and cook until brown, breaking into pieces
and stirring with spatula.
Add broth, tomato paste, cornstarch, balsamic vinegar,
oregano, salt, pepper; stir, bring to a boil and let simmer on
low until thickens a bit.
Add peas and beans, mix.
Transfer to a 9� x 13� baking dish.
Drain sweet potatoes and add coconut oil, garlic powder
and salt to the pot.
Mash with a masher until smooth.
Drop dollops of potato mixture on top of meat filling and
then spread evenly using a spatula or any long flat utensil.
Bake for 20 minutes. Serve hot.

ingredients.name:
White tuna, canned in oil, drained (15oz
can light)

Basil pesto (see Low FODMAP recipe

below)

Salt and pepper (Kosher; freshly

ground; to taste)

Extra virgin olive oil, garlic-infused (see
recipe)

meals.name: Basil Pesto Tuna Salad
meals.instruction:
Drain can of tuna and flake in a bowl.
Add pesto, green onion tops, capers, lemon juice
then stir to combine.
Season to taste with salt and pepper
Instructions for "Low-FODMAP Basil
Pesto"
Toast pine nuts in a small skillet over low heat,
stirring frequently and taking care not to burn (see
picture below). Cool to room temperature.
Add basil, garlic-infused olive oil, cheese, pine nuts,
and a few turns of freshly ground black pepper to
the food processor or blender. Blend until smooth.
Taste and adjust seasonings as necessary.
Transfer pesto to a container and if not using it
immediately, squeeze fresh lemon juice on top.
Lemon juice acts as a natural preservative to keep
the pesto bright green.

meals.name:
Nut Butter and Cream
Cheese Apples
meals.instruction:
1. Top half of the apple rounds with one layer of your choice
of nut butter. Top the other half of the apple rounds with
cream cheese.
2. Optional: Lightly drizzle the apple rounds with honey. Top
with a pinch of coarse salt.

meals.name:
Smashed Chickpea,
Avocado & Pesto Salad
Sandwich
meals.instruction:
1. Place the chickpeas on a paper towel or clean kitchen
towel and remove the outer skins. Roll them around a bit
and they will come off easily. This step is optional.
2. In a medium bowl, combine the chickpeas and avocado.
Smash with a fork until well combined. It is all right if some
of the chickpeas are chunky, this will give the mixture
texture.

3. Stir in pesto and fresh lemon juice. Season with salt and
pepper, to taste.
4. Spread chickpea salad on bread slices and top with
spinach leaves, if using. Cut sandwich in half and serve!
5. Serve with cut up veggies, crackers, or pita chips. Enjoy!

meals.name: Stovetop Popcorn
meals.instruction:
Add the oil and one kernel to a small sauce pot. Place the lid
on top and turn the heat onto high. Wait for the kernel to
pop.
Once the kernel has popped, add the rest of the kernels,
replace the lid, and give the pot a swirl to coat the kernels
in the hot oil. Wait for the kernels to begin to pop. You can

Once the kernels begin to pop rapidly, crack the lid a little
bit to allow excess steam to escape. Make sure it it only
open a little to keep the pot hot enough to continue popping
the corn.
When the popping slows to a few seconds between pops,
turn off the heat. Wait a few extra seconds for the last few
pops, then remove the lid and season the popcorn.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Whey protein powder, vanilla (or vanilla

protein powder of choice)

meals.name:
Vanilla Almond Protein
Smoothie
meals.instruction:
In a blender, combine water and spinach first. Then add
remaining ingredients. Mix until smooth and enjoy.

ingredients.name:
Atlantic salmon, wild (leave whole or

meals.name: Pecan Lime Baked Salmon
meals.instruction:
1. Spray a large baking dish with cooking spray and place
salmon in dish. Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
2. Place pecans in food processor and pulse until very finely

ingredients.name:
Avocado oil (ghee, or cooking fat of

choice)

Chicken broth (stock), low sodium (or

bone broth)

Green onion, scallion, ramp (slivered; or
finely diced white onion; optional
topping)

Yoso Plain Unsweetened Coconut Yogurt

(optional topping)

meals.name:
Instant Pot Ground Beef
Chili
meals.instruction:
Press the saut� button on the Instant Pot and wait for the metal insert to heat up. Once the insert is hot, add 1 tablespoon of
fat and swirl it around.
As soon as the oil is shimmering, add the onions and bell peppers with a sprinkle of salt.
Cook for 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until the vegetables are softened.
Stir in the tomato paste and minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add in the ground beef, along with 1 teaspoon kosher salt. Brown the meat and break it up with a spatula.
When most of the ground beef is no longer pink (5 to 7 minutes), stir in the chili powder, oregano, cumin, and cayenne
pepper (optional). Combine well to distribute the fragrant spices.
Toss in the drained diced tomatoes, broth, and fish sauce. Stir everything well, making sure the liquid reaches the bottom of
the insert.
Lock the lid and cook under high pressure for 15 minutes. (In other words, press the �Manual� or �Pressure Cook� button and
set the time for 15 minutes under high pressure.)
When the chili is finished cooking, release the pressure manually if you�re itching to eat it right away. Otherwise, you can let
the pressure come down naturally and chow down when you�re ready.
Taste the chili and adjust the seasoning if necessary. Sprinkle on some extra salt and stir in the apple cider vinegar, if
desired. Taste again to see if you need to punch up the flavors.
Ladle up the chili and serve with your favorite toppings, like sliced avocado, white onion, and cilantro!
You can store the chili in the fridge for up to 4 days in the fridge or up to 6 months in the freezer.

ingredients.name:
Cottage cheese (1% M.F.) (full fat if

available)

meals.name: Cottage Cheese Pancakes
meals.instruction:
Get a bowl or, even better, use a blender
Throw in all the ingredients and whisk/mix until
smooth
Fry in a pan with a little oil or butter on low to
medium heat.
Flip with a spatula once bubbles start to appear.
Cook until both sides are golden brown.

meals.name:
Smashed Chickpea,
Avocado & Pesto Salad
Sandwich
meals.instruction:
1. Place the chickpeas on a paper towel or clean kitchen
towel and remove the outer skins. Roll them around a bit
and they will come off easily. This step is optional.
2. In a medium bowl, combine the chickpeas and avocado.
Smash with a fork until well combined. It is all right if some
of the chickpeas are chunky, this will give the mixture
texture.

3. Stir in pesto and fresh lemon juice. Season with salt and
pepper, to taste.
4. Spread chickpea salad on bread slices and top with
spinach leaves, if using. Cut sandwich in half and serve!
5. Serve with cut up veggies, crackers, or pita chips. Enjoy!

meals.name:
Simple Scrambled Eggs,
Bacon and Toast
meals.instruction:
1. Cook bacon on low heat in cast iron or stainless steel
pan, set aside. Drain bacon grease but do not wipe out pan.
2. While bacon cooks, toast bread in toaster oven to desired
darkness. Top with grass few butter.
3. Scramble eggs in bowl; pour into pan with remaining
bacon grease. Cook, stirring frequently, until just done.
remove from pan and serve with bacon and toast.

meals.name:
Spicy Cilantro Shrimp with
Honey Lime Dip
meals.instruction:
Combine the paprika, salt, cumin, cayenne, and
cinnamon in a large bowl. Add the shrimp and toss
to fully coat the shrimp in seasoning.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-high
heat. Add the shrimp and cook about 2 minutes on
each side. You�ll know the shrimp is done when it
turns pink and curls into a �C� shape.
Toss the shrimp with fresh lime juice and cilantro
and serve with dipping sauce,
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Greek yogurt, plain, 2%
M.F. 1/2 cup
Instructions:
Mix all the ingredients and chill until ready to serve
with Spicy Cilantro Shrimp.

meals.name: Baked Eggs in Avocado
meals.instruction:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
2. Slice the avocado in half and scoop out a little flesh from
each to make room for the eggs. Place face-up on a baking
sheet.
3. Crack an egg into each half and bake for 10-15 minutes,
depending on how runny you like your eggs.

ingredients.name: Salt and pepper (to taste; for dressing)

Salmon, sockeye (red), canned, drained
(drained & large bones removed)

meals.name:
Salmon & Herbed Bean
Salad
meals.instruction:
To make the salad:
Stir the parsley, mint, tomatoes, cucumber, and beans
together in a medium bowl. In a small bowl, whisk together
the lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper until it is thick
and creamy. Pour the dressing over the beans and toss to
combine.
Divide the baby greens among 4 plates and top with the
beans. Flake the salmon over the top, and serve drizzled
with the yogurt dressing.
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Greek yogurt, plain, 2%
M.F. 1/2 cup
Instructions:
To make the dressing: Whisk together the yogurt,
minced garlic, lemon zest and juice, mint, salt,
pepper, and 1 tablespoon water (more or less
depending on preferred consistency). Set aside.

meals.name:
Cruciferous Salad with
Asian Sesame Dressing
meals.instruction:
Cook barley according to package instructions.
In a bowl combine dressing ingredients.
Place the salad mix in a large bowl and add the dressing.
Massage the dressing in with your hands to tenderize, about
2 minutes. Add carrots, zucchini, and almonds.
Portion greens into 4 mason jars. Add barley.
Tip: The morning of add protein of choice � tofu, chicken,
steak, etc.

meals.name: Peach Brie Panini
meals.instruction:
Brush both sides of the bread with olive oil.
Lay the sliced brie cheese on both pieces of toast.
Then on one piece of toast lay the peaches and stack the
argula on top.
Carefully put the two pieces of toast together and press
down slightly.
Grill a griddle or panini press. Alternatively, you can use a
dry frying pan and place a plate with something heavy on in
over top the sandwich to squish it down when you fry both
sides.

meals.name:
Mighty Brain Booster
Smoothie
meals.instruction: Combine ingredients in a blender until smooth and enjoy!

Avocado oil (ghee, or cooking fat of

Chicken broth (stock), low sodium (or

bone broth)

Green onion, scallion, ramp (slivered; or

topping)

Almond Butter Oat

meals.instruction:
1. Spread almond butter all over tortilla wrap.

2. Scatter strawberries and banana on top.

3. Sprinkle oats,chia and hemp on top of fruit. Drizzle honey
on top of everything.
Roll up the wrap and Enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Rapini, broccoli raab, raw (2cm of the

end cut off)

Red chili pepper (also chile or chilli)
(sliced)

meals.name: Steamed Garlicy Rapini
meals.instruction:
1. Steam the rapini in a metal steamer under a rolling boil
with the lid on top for no more than 4 minutes (crunchiness
is key).
2. In the mean time, slice the pepper and crush the garlic.
3. When the rapini is cooked yet still crunchy, strain out the
water and add rapini to the empty pot.
4. Over medium heat add the oil, garlic, pepper and salt.
Saute for 1-2 minutes.
5. Remove from heat and add the apple cider vinegar. Stir
to mix well and serve hot.

Almond Butter Oat
Strawberry Banana Wrap
meals.instruction:
1. Spread almond butter all over tortilla wrap.

2. Scatter strawberries and banana on top.

3. Sprinkle oats,chia and hemp on top of fruit. Drizzle honey
on top of everything.
Roll up the wrap and Enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Pork chop, loin centre cut, bone-in, lean
((3/4 inch) thick; room temperature)

Red bell pepper ( seeded and cut into
strips)

meals.name: Pork Chops and Peppers
meals.instruction:
Sprinkle the chops on both sides with the salt and
pepper.

Heat the olive oil in a heavy skillet over medium-
high heat and add the chops, onion, and garlic.

Cook the chops for 5 minutes on one side, shaking
the pan frequently so garlic doesn't burn, then turn
chops and add the pepper strips.
Cover and cook 5 to 8 minutes longer or until the
pork registers at least 145�F.
Remove the chops, onions, garlic, and the peppers
from the skillet and set aside, covered to keep
warm.
Add the Worcestershire sauce, water or chicken
broth, thyme, and marjoram to the drippings
remaining in the skillet, scraping the bottom of the
skillet with a rubber spatula to loosen the pan
drippings that contain lots of flavors.
Cook until the sauce thickens slightly, then return
the pork and vegetables to the skillet.
Cook for 1 minute longer to coat the pork with the
sauce, then serve.

ingredients.name:
Bread crumbs, whole wheat (or gluten-
free)

meals.name:
Roasted Broccoli with Dijon
& Parsley Bread Crumbs
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 450� F.
Spread out bread crumbs on a cookie sheet and toast for 3
minutes or until brown. Add bread crumbs to a large bowl
and toss well with ghee, parsley, Dijon and lemon. Add
broccoli to bread crumb mixture and toss well.
Spread out on a cookie sheet and roast for 10 minutes,
stirring once to ensure even cooking and so that the bread
crumbs don�t burn. Serve warm.
Note:
Don't have panko? No problem � it's easy to make your
own bread crumbs! Take the ends of your loaves of bread,
toast until dried out, allow to cool and grind to desired
consistency!
Serves 6-8.

meals.name: High Protein Salad in a Jar
meals.instruction:
Make dressing by mixing together yoghurt, olive oil, lemon juice, cumin, cinnamon, ginger, crushed garlic clove and chili paste. Add
honey to taste. Season with salt and pepper.
Pour dressing at the bottom of a tall glass jar. Layer on top quinoa, sliced red pepper, tomatoes, lentils. grated carrot, spinach
leaves, seeds, sprouts and chopped mint leaves.
Close tightly and store in the fridge overnight.

meals.name:
Almond Butter Oat
Strawberry Banana Wrap
meals.instruction:
1. Spread almond butter all over tortilla wrap.

2. Scatter strawberries and banana on top.

3. Sprinkle oats,chia and hemp on top of fruit. Drizzle honey
on top of everything.
Roll up the wrap and Enjoy!

meals.name:
Creamy Vegan Carbonara
with Shiitake Bacon
meals.instruction:
To Make the Shiitake Bacon
Preheat oven to 350�F.
Line a baking pan with parchment paper.
In a bowl, add the shiitakes, olive oil, sea salt, liquid smoke and black pepper to the pan. Toss to thoroughly coat. Transfer to
baking pan.
Bake for 20-30 minutes, turning and flipping every so often (5-8 min) until golden brown and crispy.
Remove from oven and transfer the shiitake bacon to a plate lined with a paper towel. Pat off excess oil and let cool.
To Make the Hemp Parmesan
Add the hemp hearts, nutritional yeast, and sea salt to a food processor. Process for 1-2 minutes and transfer to a small
bowl. Refrigerate until ready to use.
To Make the Carbonara Pasta
Turn the oven up to 400�F.
Add the zucchini, garlic, shallots, and olive oil to a pan. Bake for 30 minutes, flipping halfway through baking.
Add the roasted zucchini mixture to a blender along with the nutritional yeast, almond or rice milk, white wine vinegar,
arrowroot powder, sea salt, black/truffle salt, and black pepper. Blend on high for 1-2 minutes or until smooth.
Pour the mixture into a medium sauce pan over medium-low heat. Whisk continuously for 3-4 minutes until thickened.
Add the cooked linguine to a large serving bowl. Pour the creamy sauce over top and toss to coat (add in pasta water as
needed to loosen the sauce).
Divide between bowls, and top with the hemp seed parmesan, shiitake bacon, and fresh parsley.

meals.name:
Instant Pot Ground Beef
Chili
meals.instruction:
Press the saut� button on the Instant Pot and wait for the metal insert to heat up. Once the insert is hot, add 1 tablespoon of
fat and swirl it around.
As soon as the oil is shimmering, add the onions and bell peppers with a sprinkle of salt.
Cook for 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until the vegetables are softened.
Stir in the tomato paste and minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add in the ground beef, along with 1 teaspoon kosher salt. Brown the meat and break it up with a spatula.
When most of the ground beef is no longer pink (5 to 7 minutes), stir in the chili powder, oregano, cumin, and cayenne
pepper (optional). Combine well to distribute the fragrant spices.
Toss in the drained diced tomatoes, broth, and fish sauce. Stir everything well, making sure the liquid reaches the bottom of
the insert.
Lock the lid and cook under high pressure for 15 minutes. (In other words, press the �Manual� or �Pressure Cook� button and
set the time for 15 minutes under high pressure.)
When the chili is finished cooking, release the pressure manually if you�re itching to eat it right away. Otherwise, you can let
the pressure come down naturally and chow down when you�re ready.
Taste the chili and adjust the seasoning if necessary. Sprinkle on some extra salt and stir in the apple cider vinegar, if
desired. Taste again to see if you need to punch up the flavors.
Ladle up the chili and serve with your favorite toppings, like sliced avocado, white onion, and cilantro!
You can store the chili in the fridge for up to 4 days in the fridge or up to 6 months in the freezer.

ingredients.name:
Oyster mushroom (chopped into large
pieces; or whatever mushroom you
prefer)

Green bell pepper (chopped into large
pieces)

Rapini, broccoli raab, raw (chopped into

meals.name: Lean & Green Tofu Stir-Fry
meals.instruction:
Spray a non-stick skillet with cooking spray and heat
over medium heat. Add onion and mushrooms and
saute until onions are translucent and mushrooms
have softened (about 2-3 minutes).
Add the green pepper, rapini, and edamame and
saute for 3-4 minutes.
Now add tofu and garlic to the skillet. Toss to
combine and cook for 1-2 minutes more.
Add your oyster sauce, soy sauce, and nutritional
yeast to the pan. Stir until everything is well coated.
Add spinach and tomatoes. Cook for 2-3 minutes
longer until spinach starts to wilt slightly. Top with
sriracha and chopped peanuts. Enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Pork chop, loin centre cut, bone-in, lean
((3/4 inch) thick; room temperature)

Red bell pepper ( seeded and cut into
strips)

meals.name: Pork Chops and Peppers
meals.instruction:
Sprinkle the chops on both sides with the salt and
pepper.

Heat the olive oil in a heavy skillet over medium-
high heat and add the chops, onion, and garlic.

Cook the chops for 5 minutes on one side, shaking
the pan frequently so garlic doesn't burn, then turn
chops and add the pepper strips.
Cover and cook 5 to 8 minutes longer or until the
pork registers at least 145�F.
Remove the chops, onions, garlic, and the peppers
from the skillet and set aside, covered to keep
warm.
Add the Worcestershire sauce, water or chicken
broth, thyme, and marjoram to the drippings
remaining in the skillet, scraping the bottom of the
skillet with a rubber spatula to loosen the pan
drippings that contain lots of flavors.
Cook until the sauce thickens slightly, then return
the pork and vegetables to the skillet.
Cook for 1 minute longer to coat the pork with the
sauce, then serve.

ingredients.name:

Red onion (sliced, or any topping of

Cremini (Italian) mushroom (sliced, or

meals.name: Easy Cauliflower Pizza
meals.instruction:
Preheat the oven to 400oF and line a baking sheet/
pizza pan with parchment paper.
In a large food processor fitted with an �S� blade,
pulse the cauliflower florets several times, until a
rice-like consistency is achieved.
Pour the cauliflower into the center of a thin dish
towel, then twist it up and use your hands to firmly
wring out the moisture (quite a lot of liquid should
be released, leaving you with a dry lump of
cauliflower pulp).
Place the cauliflower pulp in a large mixing bowl and
mix in the egg, goat cheese, oregano, basil, and salt,
stirring well to create a uniform mixture.
Transfer the cauliflower mixture to the baking sheet
and use your hands to press the crust firmly into a
large circular or rectangular crust, about 1/4 inch
thick (be sure to pack the cauliflower mixture
together firmly and evenly, leaving no thin spots
where the crust may crack).
Bake for 30 minutes, until the top is dry and golden,
then carefully flip the crust over and bake for
another ?0 minutes.
Add your favorite sauce and toppings (see "Notes"
below) and then bake for another ?0 minutes at
400oF, until the topping are heated thoroughly. Slice
and serve hot.

meals.name: Berry Smoothie Bowl
meals.instruction:
Blend all smoothie ingredients together.
Enjoy!

meals.name:
Cruciferous Salad with
Asian Sesame Dressing
meals.instruction:
Cook barley according to package instructions.
In a bowl combine dressing ingredients.
Place the salad mix in a large bowl and add the dressing.
Massage the dressing in with your hands to tenderize, about
2 minutes. Add carrots, zucchini, and almonds.
Portion greens into 4 mason jars. Add barley.
Tip: The morning of add protein of choice � tofu, chicken,
steak, etc.

meals.name:
Broccoli Cashew Stir-Fry
With Brown Rice
meals.instruction:
1. Cook rice as directed on packaging.
2. In a small bowl, mix together all ingredients for the
sauce. Set aside.
3. Heat a large fry pan or wok over medium-high heat. Add
cashews and roast for 2 to 3 minutes. Stirring frequently.
Careful not to burn them. Set aside with the green parts of
the green onion.
4. In the same pan, add the sesame oil and heat over
medium-high heat. Add the white parts of the green onion,
broccoli and mushrooms. Saut� for about 5 minutes or until
broccoli is starting to become tender. Add 3-6 tablespoons
of water, if needed, to stop browning or burning.
5. Add the snow peas and bok choy and saut� for 2
minutes.
6. Add the sauce and saut� for about 3 to 5 minutes or until
the sauce thickens. Remove from heat and add in the
cashews and green parts of the green onion.
7. Serve immediately with brown rice.

White onion (cut in half and into 1/2-
inch slices)

meals.name: Greek Style Green Beans
meals.instruction:
Heat ghee in a large saut� pan over medium heat. Add
onion and cook for 4 minutes or until onions start to soften.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Add green beans,
tomatoes and water and cook covered, for 7 minutes.
Stir in parsley and dill and remove from heat. Serve warm.
Note:
To save time trimming the beans, simply line up all the
stem ends and trim in one cut with a chef 's knife.

meals.name: Baked Eggs in Avocado
meals.instruction:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
2. Slice the avocado in half and scoop out a little flesh from
each to make room for the eggs. Place face-up on a baking
sheet.
3. Crack an egg into each half and bake for 10-15 minutes,
depending on how runny you like your eggs.

meals.name:
Cottage Cheese & Fruit
Snack

These two ingredients make for the easiest high protein
snack to keep you feeling satisfied between meals.

3. Crack an egg into each half and bake for 10-15 minutes,

meals.name: Basil Pesto Tuna Salad
meals.instruction:
Drain can of tuna and flake in a bowl.
Add pesto, green onion tops, capers, lemon juice
then stir to combine.
Season to taste with salt and pepper
Instructions for "Low-FODMAP Basil
Pesto"
Toast pine nuts in a small skillet over low heat,
stirring frequently and taking care not to burn (see
picture below). Cool to room temperature.
Add basil, garlic-infused olive oil, cheese, pine nuts,
and a few turns of freshly ground black pepper to
the food processor or blender. Blend until smooth.
Taste and adjust seasonings as necessary.
Transfer pesto to a container and if not using it
immediately, squeeze fresh lemon juice on top.
Lemon juice acts as a natural preservative to keep
the pesto bright green.

meals.name:
Spicy Cilantro Shrimp with
Honey Lime Dip
meals.instruction:
Combine the paprika, salt, cumin, cayenne, and
cinnamon in a large bowl. Add the shrimp and toss
to fully coat the shrimp in seasoning.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-high
heat. Add the shrimp and cook about 2 minutes on
each side. You�ll know the shrimp is done when it
turns pink and curls into a �C� shape.
Toss the shrimp with fresh lime juice and cilantro
and serve with dipping sauce,
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Greek yogurt, plain, 2%
M.F. 1/2 cup
Instructions:
Mix all the ingredients and chill until ready to serve
with Spicy Cilantro Shrimp.

Jalapeno peppers, sliced, canned

meals.name:
Chopped Taco Mason Jar
Salad
meals.instruction:
In a medium pan cook ground turkey until no longer pink.
Add black beans, seasoning packet, and the amount of
water stated in seasoning packet directions. Let taco
mixture cool.
Divide ingredients among 5 mason jars starting with salsa
then adding greek yogurt, tomatoes, cucumbers, onions,
jalape�os, avocados, taco meat, then lettuce. Place lid on
and close tight. No need to vacuum seal or anything like
that.
When ready to eat, shake real good, then pour into a bowl
and enjoy. Can serve with tortilla chips.

meals.name:
Simple Scrambled Eggs,
Bacon and Toast
meals.instruction:
1. Cook bacon on low heat in cast iron or stainless steel
pan, set aside. Drain bacon grease but do not wipe out pan.
2. While bacon cooks, toast bread in toaster oven to desired
darkness. Top with grass few butter.
3. Scramble eggs in bowl; pour into pan with remaining
bacon grease. Cook, stirring frequently, until just done.
remove from pan and serve with bacon and toast.

meals.name: Kale-Hemp Pesto
meals.instruction:
Place kale, hemp seeds, garlic, salt, parmesan, and lemon
juice in a food processor fitted with the blade attachment.
Process until combined, then, with the machine running,
drizzle in olive oil until mixture looks totally smooth. Cover
and store in fridge for up to 5 days.
Note:
Serve with gluten-free pasta.
This recipe makes 1 cup of pesto. 1 cup = 16 tbsp. Serving
size is based on 2 tbsp.

meals.name: Simple Breakfast Taco
meals.instruction:
Spray a bowl or mug with cooking spray. Add the
spinach and microwave for 30 seconds.
Remove from the microwave and add the eggs and
milk or water, stir. Season with salt, pepper, and any
other spices. Microwave for 1.5-2 minutes until fluffy.
Add the egg mixture to the tortillas and top with
cheese and salsa. Enjoy!

meals.name:
Mozzarella Pesto Panini
with Basil
meals.instruction:
If your bun is large, use only one halve by cutting
it in half to make a small sandwich.
Spread pesto on both sides of bun and lay the
mozzarella on both halves.
Place whole basil leaves and tomato slices on one
half of the bun and top with the other half of the bun
(tomato and basil should be sandwiched between
mozzarella).
Use a panini press to grill the sandwich for 2-3
minutes until cheese melts (see "Notes" below).

meals.name: Chocolate Dream Smoothie
meals.instruction:
In a high speed blender, add all ingredients in the order
listed. Blend on high speed for one minute.
Add water or ice, if needed, to reach your desired thickness.
Note:
Cacao vs. Cocoa � What�s the difference?
Raw cacao is superior to cocoa powder because it is made
by cold-pressing un-roasted cocoa beans. It is an excellent
source of essential fatty acids, fiber, magnesium, zinc, iron
and calcium.
Cocoa powder is made from cocoa beans that have been
roasted at high temperatures.
If you can�t find cacao, buy unprocessed, non-alkalized
cocoa powder.

meals.name: Pecan Lime Baked Salmon
meals.instruction:
1. Spray a large baking dish with cooking spray and place
salmon in dish. Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
2. Place pecans in food processor and pulse until very finely
chopped. Place in a bowl and mix with brown sugar, lime
juice, dill, and salt and pepper until a paste forms.
3. Rub mixture onto salmon and bake in pre-heated oven for
about 15 minutes.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Garlic Parmesan Roasted Potatoes
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 400�F. Lightly oil a baking sheet or
coat with nonstick spray.
Place potatoes in a single layer onto the prepared
baking sheet. Add olive oil, garlic, thyme, oregano,
basil, and Parmesan; season with salt and pepper, to
taste. Gently toss to combine.
Place into oven and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until
golden brown and crisp. Stir in butter until melted,
about 1 minute.
Serve immediately, garnished with parsley.

meals.name: High Protein Salad in a Jar
meals.instruction:
Make dressing by mixing together yoghurt, olive oil, lemon juice, cumin, cinnamon, ginger, crushed garlic clove and chili paste. Add
honey to taste. Season with salt and pepper.
Pour dressing at the bottom of a tall glass jar. Layer on top quinoa, sliced red pepper, tomatoes, lentils. grated carrot, spinach
leaves, seeds, sprouts and chopped mint leaves.
Close tightly and store in the fridge overnight.

ingredients.name:
Jalapeno peppers, sliced, canned
(drained and chopped)

meals.name:
Chopped Taco Mason Jar
Salad
meals.instruction:
In a medium pan cook ground turkey until no longer pink.
Add black beans, seasoning packet, and the amount of
water stated in seasoning packet directions. Let taco
mixture cool.
Divide ingredients among 5 mason jars starting with salsa
then adding greek yogurt, tomatoes, cucumbers, onions,
jalape�os, avocados, taco meat, then lettuce. Place lid on
and close tight. No need to vacuum seal or anything like
that.
When ready to eat, shake real good, then pour into a bowl
and enjoy. Can serve with tortilla chips.

ingredients.name:
Avocado oil (ghee, or cooking fat of

choice)

Chicken broth (stock), low sodium (or

bone broth)

Green onion, scallion, ramp (slivered; or
finely diced white onion; optional
topping)

Yoso Plain Unsweetened Coconut Yogurt

(optional topping)

meals.name:
Instant Pot Ground Beef
Chili
meals.instruction:
Press the saut� button on the Instant Pot and wait for the metal insert to heat up. Once the insert is hot, add 1 tablespoon of
fat and swirl it around.
As soon as the oil is shimmering, add the onions and bell peppers with a sprinkle of salt.
Cook for 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until the vegetables are softened.
Stir in the tomato paste and minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add in the ground beef, along with 1 teaspoon kosher salt. Brown the meat and break it up with a spatula.
When most of the ground beef is no longer pink (5 to 7 minutes), stir in the chili powder, oregano, cumin, and cayenne
pepper (optional). Combine well to distribute the fragrant spices.
Toss in the drained diced tomatoes, broth, and fish sauce. Stir everything well, making sure the liquid reaches the bottom of
the insert.
Lock the lid and cook under high pressure for 15 minutes. (In other words, press the �Manual� or �Pressure Cook� button and
set the time for 15 minutes under high pressure.)
When the chili is finished cooking, release the pressure manually if you�re itching to eat it right away. Otherwise, you can let
the pressure come down naturally and chow down when you�re ready.
Taste the chili and adjust the seasoning if necessary. Sprinkle on some extra salt and stir in the apple cider vinegar, if
desired. Taste again to see if you need to punch up the flavors.
Ladle up the chili and serve with your favorite toppings, like sliced avocado, white onion, and cilantro!
You can store the chili in the fridge for up to 4 days in the fridge or up to 6 months in the freezer.

meals.name:
Almond Butter Oat
Strawberry Banana Wrap
meals.instruction:
1. Spread almond butter all over tortilla wrap.

2. Scatter strawberries and banana on top.

3. Sprinkle oats,chia and hemp on top of fruit. Drizzle honey
on top of everything.
Roll up the wrap and Enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Avocado oil (or grape seed oil, for

dressing)

meals.name:
Crunchy Asian Ramen
Noodle Salad
meals.instruction:
Heat oven to 425�F. Spread the crumbled ramen
noodles and sliced almonds out on a baking sheet,
and stir a bit to combine. Bake for about 5 minutes,
or until the almonds and noodles are slightly toasted
and golden. Remove baking sheet, and give the
mixture a good stir to toss. Then return it to the
oven and roast for an additional 3 minutes. Keep a
very close eye on the mixture so that it does not
burn. Remove and set aside.
Add ingredients (including the vinaigrette) together
in a large bowl, and toss until combined.
Serve immediately, or cover and refrigerate for up to
3 days (see "Notes" below)
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Avocado oil 1/8 cup
Instructions:
Whisk all dressing ingredients together until
combined. Store in a glass jar in the fridge.

meals.name:
Simple Scrambled Eggs,
Bacon and Toast
meals.instruction:
1. Cook bacon on low heat in cast iron or stainless steel
pan, set aside. Drain bacon grease but do not wipe out pan.
2. While bacon cooks, toast bread in toaster oven to desired
darkness. Top with grass few butter.
3. Scramble eggs in bowl; pour into pan with remaining
bacon grease. Cook, stirring frequently, until just done.
remove from pan and serve with bacon and toast.

ingredients.name:
Green onion, scallion, ramp (sliced,
separate the white parts from the green
parts)

meals.name:
Broccoli Cashew Stir-Fry
With Brown Rice
meals.instruction:
1. Cook rice as directed on packaging.
2. In a small bowl, mix together all ingredients for the
sauce. Set aside.
3. Heat a large fry pan or wok over medium-high heat. Add
cashews and roast for 2 to 3 minutes. Stirring frequently.
Careful not to burn them. Set aside with the green parts of
the green onion.
4. In the same pan, add the sesame oil and heat over
medium-high heat. Add the white parts of the green onion,
broccoli and mushrooms. Saut� for about 5 minutes or until
broccoli is starting to become tender. Add 3-6 tablespoons
of water, if needed, to stop browning or burning.
5. Add the snow peas and bok choy and saut� for 2
minutes.
6. Add the sauce and saut� for about 3 to 5 minutes or until
the sauce thickens. Remove from heat and add in the
cashews and green parts of the green onion.
7. Serve immediately with brown rice.

meals.name:
Nut Butter and Cream
Cheese Apples
meals.instruction:
1. Top half of the apple rounds with one layer of your choice
of nut butter. Top the other half of the apple rounds with
cream cheese.
2. Optional: Lightly drizzle the apple rounds with honey. Top
with a pinch of coarse salt.

meals.name:
Almond Butter Oat
Strawberry Banana Wrap
meals.instruction:
1. Spread almond butter all over tortilla wrap.

2. Scatter strawberries and banana on top.

3. Sprinkle oats,chia and hemp on top of fruit. Drizzle honey
on top of everything.
Roll up the wrap and Enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Ranch salad dressing, reduced fat (or
sour cream or Greek yogurt, dressing)

meals.name: Southwest Salad in a Jar
meals.instruction:
Combine ingredients for dressing and pour into the bottom
of your mason jar and begin layering your ingredients in
this order: romaine, beans, corn, tomato, romaine, green
onion, olives, cheese.
Serve immediately or store in the fridge 2-3 days.

meals.name:
Spicy Cilantro Shrimp with
Honey Lime Dip
meals.instruction:
Combine the paprika, salt, cumin, cayenne, and
cinnamon in a large bowl. Add the shrimp and toss
to fully coat the shrimp in seasoning.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-high
heat. Add the shrimp and cook about 2 minutes on
each side. You�ll know the shrimp is done when it
turns pink and curls into a �C� shape.
Toss the shrimp with fresh lime juice and cilantro
and serve with dipping sauce,
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Greek yogurt, plain, 2%
M.F. 1/2 cup
Instructions:
Mix all the ingredients and chill until ready to serve
with Spicy Cilantro Shrimp.

ingredients.name:
Almond milk, unsweetened (almond or

coconut, unsweetened)

Almond butter (can use any nut or seed

butter)

Fermented protein powder, vanilla
(Garden of Life all in one - any flavor is
okay)

meals.name: Berry Smoothie Bowl
meals.instruction:
Blend all smoothie ingredients together.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Almond milk, unsweetened (or hemp or

coconut)

meals.name: Apple Cinnamon Overnight Oats
meals.instruction:
In a one-pint sized mason jar combine dry ingredients.
Add remaining ingredients and stir well.
Place lid on container and leave on the counter at room
temperature or in the fridge, overnight.
In the morning, eat the goodness. Add more maple syrup if
desired.

meals.name:
Spicy Cilantro Shrimp with
Honey Lime Dip
meals.instruction:
Combine the paprika, salt, cumin, cayenne, and
cinnamon in a large bowl. Add the shrimp and toss
to fully coat the shrimp in seasoning.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-high

meals.name:
Vegan Buttermilk Mashed
Potatoes
meals.instruction:
Peel and chop up your potatoes into 1/2 inch chunks.
Add them to a large pot with 6 cups water. Bring to a
boil and once boiling, add both the teaspoons of salt
and garlic powder and give it a quick stir (this really
flavors the water, so that the potatoes have depth of
flavor). Turn the heat to medium-high, so they don't
cook on too high of heat. Cook for about 15 minutes
until they are fork tender. Drain and let sit for 5
minutes to release some of the water.
While the potatoes are cooking, add the coconut
milk and vinegar to a cup and stir. Let sit for a few
minutes.
Add the salt, pepper and garlic powder to the milk
and stir.
Add the potatoes to a large serving bowl and
roughly mash with a potato masher to break them
up.
Now add the reserved coconut milk mixture and
mash again until very smooth or until desired
consistency (if you want yours less fluffy/more
creamy, add more milk, but you'll need more
spices). Taste and add any extra salt/spices if
desired.

meals.name: Baked Eggs in Avocado
meals.instruction:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
2. Slice the avocado in half and scoop out a little flesh from
each to make room for the eggs. Place face-up on a baking
sheet.
3. Crack an egg into each half and bake for 10-15 minutes,
depending on how runny you like your eggs.

ingredients.name:
Oyster mushroom (or any mushroom

you prefer)
Red bell pepper ( cut into chunks)
Green bell pepper ( cut into chunks)

meals.name: Vegetable Kabobs
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 400�F.
In a very large bowl, whisk together olive oil, garlic,
lemon juice, oregano and basil; season with salt and
pepper, to taste.
Toss vegetables in and mix well to cover all the
pieces (see "Notes" below).
Thread mushrooms, tomatoes, bell peppers, onion
and zucchini onto skewers. Place skewers onto a
baking sheet. Pour any remaining dressing over the
skewers.
Place into oven and roast until tender, about 10-12
minutes. Serve immediately.

ingredients.name:
Oyster mushroom (chopped into large
pieces; or whatever mushroom you
prefer)

Green bell pepper (chopped into large
pieces)

Rapini, broccoli raab, raw (chopped into

large pieces)

Tofu, regular, extra firm (pressed &
chopped into bite-size cubes)

meals.name: Lean & Green Tofu Stir-Fry
meals.instruction:
Spray a non-stick skillet with cooking spray and heat
over medium heat. Add onion and mushrooms and
saute until onions are translucent and mushrooms
have softened (about 2-3 minutes).
Add the green pepper, rapini, and edamame and
saute for 3-4 minutes.
Now add tofu and garlic to the skillet. Toss to
combine and cook for 1-2 minutes more.
Add your oyster sauce, soy sauce, and nutritional
yeast to the pan. Stir until everything is well coated.
Add spinach and tomatoes. Cook for 2-3 minutes
longer until spinach starts to wilt slightly. Top with
sriracha and chopped peanuts. Enjoy!

meals.name: Peach Brie Panini
meals.instruction:
Brush both sides of the bread with olive oil.
Lay the sliced brie cheese on both pieces of toast.
Then on one piece of toast lay the peaches and stack the
argula on top.
Carefully put the two pieces of toast together and press
down slightly.
Grill a griddle or panini press. Alternatively, you can use a
dry frying pan and place a plate with something heavy on in
over top the sandwich to squish it down when you fry both
sides.

ingredients.name:
Pork chop, loin centre cut, bone-in, lean
((3/4 inch) thick; room temperature)

Red bell pepper ( seeded and cut into
strips)

meals.name: Pork Chops and Peppers
meals.instruction:
Sprinkle the chops on both sides with the salt and
pepper.

Heat the olive oil in a heavy skillet over medium-
high heat and add the chops, onion, and garlic.

Cook the chops for 5 minutes on one side, shaking
the pan frequently so garlic doesn't burn, then turn
chops and add the pepper strips.
Cover and cook 5 to 8 minutes longer or until the
pork registers at least 145�F.
Remove the chops, onions, garlic, and the peppers
from the skillet and set aside, covered to keep
warm.
Add the Worcestershire sauce, water or chicken
broth, thyme, and marjoram to the drippings
remaining in the skillet, scraping the bottom of the
skillet with a rubber spatula to loosen the pan
drippings that contain lots of flavors.
Cook until the sauce thickens slightly, then return
the pork and vegetables to the skillet.
Cook for 1 minute longer to coat the pork with the
sauce, then serve.

ingredients.name:
White onion (cut in half and into 1/2-
inch slices)

meals.name: Greek Style Green Beans
meals.instruction:
Heat ghee in a large saut� pan over medium heat. Add
onion and cook for 4 minutes or until onions start to soften.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Add green beans,
tomatoes and water and cook covered, for 7 minutes.
Stir in parsley and dill and remove from heat. Serve warm.
Note:
To save time trimming the beans, simply line up all the
stem ends and trim in one cut with a chef 's knife.

ingredients.name:
Bread crumbs, whole wheat (or gluten-
free)

meals.name:
Roasted Broccoli with Dijon
& Parsley Bread Crumbs
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 450� F.
Spread out bread crumbs on a cookie sheet and toast for 3
minutes or until brown. Add bread crumbs to a large bowl
and toss well with ghee, parsley, Dijon and lemon. Add
broccoli to bread crumb mixture and toss well.
Spread out on a cookie sheet and roast for 10 minutes,
stirring once to ensure even cooking and so that the bread
crumbs don�t burn. Serve warm.
Note:
Don't have panko? No problem � it's easy to make your
own bread crumbs! Take the ends of your loaves of bread,
toast until dried out, allow to cool and grind to desired
consistency!
Serves 6-8.

ingredients.name:
Pasta, macaroni, elbow, whole wheat,

cooked

Red bell pepper (chopped, optional for
color)

meals.name:
Best Ever Vegan Mac &
Cheese
meals.instruction:
Place cashews in the food processor and finely grind
(just don�t let the cashews turn to a cashew butter).
Add red pepper and process until smooth. Set aside.
In a heavy saucepan, combine milk, oil and
cornstarch. Bring to a simmer over high heat.
Decrease heat to low, cover and simmer, stirring
occasionally for 10 minutes, or until cornstarch
dissolves.
Using a whisk or large fork, stir in the ground
cashews, nutritional yeast, miso paste, lemon juice,
onion powder, garlic powder and salt until well
combined.
Add the cashew cheese to the macaroni noodles,
drizzle with truffle oil (if using), a dash of freshly
ground black pepper and serve.

White onion (cut in half and into 1/2-
inch slices)

meals.name: Greek Style Green Beans

meals.name: Kale-Hemp Pesto
meals.instruction:
Place kale, hemp seeds, garlic, salt, parmesan, and lemon
juice in a food processor fitted with the blade attachment.
Process until combined, then, with the machine running,
drizzle in olive oil until mixture looks totally smooth. Cover
and store in fridge for up to 5 days.
Note:
Serve with gluten-free pasta.
This recipe makes 1 cup of pesto. 1 cup = 16 tbsp. Serving
size is based on 2 tbsp.

meals.name:
Mighty Brain Booster
Smoothie
meals.instruction: Combine ingredients in a blender until smooth and enjoy!

ingredients.name:
White onion (cut in half and into 1/2-
inch slices)

meals.name: Greek Style Green Beans
meals.instruction:
Heat ghee in a large saut� pan over medium heat. Add
onion and cook for 4 minutes or until onions start to soften.

meals.name:
Butternut Squash Ramen
Bowl
meals.instruction:
Combine the squash, broth, salt, garlic and soy
sauce in a medium pot, and stir to mix well until
bubbling and hot (basically to a light boil), about 3-4
minutes.
While the broth is heating up, cube the fresh tofu
into one-inch pieces or a little smaller, as per your
preference. Slice the green onion, and wash and trim
the pea shoots, removing the tough stems.
Take the strand of dry rice noodles, and with your
hands, snap them in half to shorten to noodle
strands, and place them in a generously sized
serving bowl of your choice.
When the broth has reached a bubbling boil, remove
it from the heat and pour all of it over the rice
noodles directly into the serving bowl. Using a fork
and a quick, firm hand, push any errant noodle
strands under the broth to submerge any loose
pieces. Cover the bowl immediately with a small
plate, and set your timer for 6 minutes.
When the 6 minutes is up, remove the plate from
the bowl and stir the noodles to break them up a
little. To serve, push the noodles over to the side a
little, making room for the tofu, scallions & pea
shoots which can be arranged directly into the broth
as you like. Place a little Sambal Oelek in the center
of the bowl, and finish by pouring the toasted
sesame oil into the bowl along with the black
sesame seeds to garnish.
Serve right away with chopsticks or a fork.

ingredients.name:
Dairy-free mozzarella cheese shreds,
Daiya (or fresh mozzarella, thickly
sliced)

meals.name:
Mozzarella Pesto Panini
with Basil
meals.instruction:
If your bun is large, use only one halve by cutting
it in half to make a small sandwich.
Spread pesto on both sides of bun and lay the
mozzarella on both halves.
Place whole basil leaves and tomato slices on one
half of the bun and top with the other half of the bun
(tomato and basil should be sandwiched between
mozzarella).
Use a panini press to grill the sandwich for 2-3
minutes until cheese melts (see "Notes" below).

ingredients.name:
Rapini, broccoli raab, raw (2cm of the

end cut off)

Red chili pepper (also chile or chilli)
(sliced)

meals.name: Steamed Garlicy Rapini
meals.instruction:
1. Steam the rapini in a metal steamer under a rolling boil
with the lid on top for no more than 4 minutes (crunchiness
is key).
2. In the mean time, slice the pepper and crush the garlic.
3. When the rapini is cooked yet still crunchy, strain out the
water and add rapini to the empty pot.
4. Over medium heat add the oil, garlic, pepper and salt.
Saute for 1-2 minutes.
5. Remove from heat and add the apple cider vinegar. Stir
to mix well and serve hot.

ingredients.name:
Almond milk, unsweetened (almond or

coconut, unsweetened)

Almond butter (can use any nut or seed

butter)

Fermented protein powder, vanilla
(Garden of Life all in one - any flavor is
okay)

meals.name: Berry Smoothie Bowl
meals.instruction:
Blend all smoothie ingredients together.
Enjoy!

meals.instruction:

Lay the sliced brie cheese on both pieces of toast.
Then on one piece of toast lay the peaches and stack the
argula on top.
Carefully put the two pieces of toast together and press
down slightly.
Grill a griddle or panini press. Alternatively, you can use a
dry frying pan and place a plate with something heavy on in
over top the sandwich to squish it down when you fry both
sides.

meals.name: Shepherds Pie
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 200 degrees.
In a medium pot, add sweet potatoes and cover with water.
Bring to a boil, cover and cook on low for 15 minutes or
until fork tender.
In the meanwhile, preheat large non-stick or cast iron skillet
on medium heat and swirl olive oil to coat.
Add onions and garlic, saute for a few minutes, stirring
occasionally.
Add carrots and cook for a few more minutes.
Add ground meat and cook until brown, breaking into pieces
and stirring with spatula.
Add broth, tomato paste, cornstarch, balsamic vinegar,
oregano, salt, pepper; stir, bring to a boil and let simmer on
low until thickens a bit.
Add peas and beans, mix.
Transfer to a 9� x 13� baking dish.
Drain sweet potatoes and add coconut oil, garlic powder
and salt to the pot.
Mash with a masher until smooth.
Drop dollops of potato mixture on top of meat filling and
then spread evenly using a spatula or any long flat utensil.
Bake for 20 minutes. Serve hot.

ingredients.name:
Nuts, mixed nuts, dry
roasted with peanuts,
salted

meals.name:

roasted with peanuts,
salted
Baked Eggs in Avocado
meals.instruction:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
2. Slice the avocado in half and scoop out a little flesh from
each to make room for the eggs. Place face-up on a baking
sheet.
3. Crack an egg into each half and bake for 10-15 minutes,
depending on how runny you like your eggs.

Cashew nuts, raw (optional, but
recommended to soak for 30 min)

meals.name: Garlic Dill Dip
meals.instruction: In a blender, process all of the ingredients until smooth.

Yoso Plain Unsweetened Coconut Yogurt

(optional topping)

meals.name:
Instant Pot Ground Beef
Chili
meals.instruction:
Press the saut� button on the Instant Pot and wait for the metal insert to heat up. Once the insert is hot, add 1 tablespoon of
fat and swirl it around.
As soon as the oil is shimmering, add the onions and bell peppers with a sprinkle of salt.
Cook for 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until the vegetables are softened.
Stir in the tomato paste and minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add in the ground beef, along with 1 teaspoon kosher salt. Brown the meat and break it up with a spatula.
When most of the ground beef is no longer pink (5 to 7 minutes), stir in the chili powder, oregano, cumin, and cayenne
pepper (optional). Combine well to distribute the fragrant spices.
Toss in the drained diced tomatoes, broth, and fish sauce. Stir everything well, making sure the liquid reaches the bottom of
the insert.
Lock the lid and cook under high pressure for 15 minutes. (In other words, press the �Manual� or �Pressure Cook� button and
set the time for 15 minutes under high pressure.)
When the chili is finished cooking, release the pressure manually if you�re itching to eat it right away. Otherwise, you can let
the pressure come down naturally and chow down when you�re ready.
Taste the chili and adjust the seasoning if necessary. Sprinkle on some extra salt and stir in the apple cider vinegar, if
desired. Taste again to see if you need to punch up the flavors.
Ladle up the chili and serve with your favorite toppings, like sliced avocado, white onion, and cilantro!
You can store the chili in the fridge for up to 4 days in the fridge or up to 6 months in the freezer.

meals.name:
Vegan Buttermilk Mashed
Potatoes
meals.instruction:
Peel and chop up your potatoes into 1/2 inch chunks.
Add them to a large pot with 6 cups water. Bring to a
boil and once boiling, add both the teaspoons of salt
and garlic powder and give it a quick stir (this really
flavors the water, so that the potatoes have depth of
flavor). Turn the heat to medium-high, so they don't
cook on too high of heat. Cook for about 15 minutes
until they are fork tender. Drain and let sit for 5
minutes to release some of the water.
While the potatoes are cooking, add the coconut
milk and vinegar to a cup and stir. Let sit for a few
minutes.
Add the salt, pepper and garlic powder to the milk
and stir.
Add the potatoes to a large serving bowl and
roughly mash with a potato masher to break them
up.
Now add the reserved coconut milk mixture and
mash again until very smooth or until desired
consistency (if you want yours less fluffy/more
creamy, add more milk, but you'll need more
spices). Taste and add any extra salt/spices if
desired.

meals.name:
Mighty Brain Booster
Smoothie
meals.instruction: Combine ingredients in a blender until smooth and enjoy!

ingredients.name:
Dairy-free mozzarella cheese shreds,
Daiya (or fresh mozzarella, thickly
sliced)

meals.name:
Mozzarella Pesto Panini
with Basil
meals.instruction:
If your bun is large, use only one halve by cutting
it in half to make a small sandwich.
Spread pesto on both sides of bun and lay the
mozzarella on both halves.
Place whole basil leaves and tomato slices on one
half of the bun and top with the other half of the bun
(tomato and basil should be sandwiched between
mozzarella).
Use a panini press to grill the sandwich for 2-3
minutes until cheese melts (see "Notes" below).

ingredients.name:
Nuts, mixed nuts, dry
roasted with peanuts,
salted

meals.name:
Nuts, mixed nuts, dry
roasted with peanuts,
salted
Garlic Parmesan Roasted Potatoes
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 400�F. Lightly oil a baking sheet or
coat with nonstick spray.
Place potatoes in a single layer onto the prepared
baking sheet. Add olive oil, garlic, thyme, oregano,
basil, and Parmesan; season with salt and pepper, to
taste. Gently toss to combine.
Place into oven and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until
golden brown and crisp. Stir in butter until melted,
about 1 minute.
Serve immediately, garnished with parsley.

meals.name:
Smashed Chickpea,
Avocado & Pesto Salad
Sandwich
meals.instruction:
1. Place the chickpeas on a paper towel or clean kitchen
towel and remove the outer skins. Roll them around a bit
and they will come off easily. This step is optional.
2. In a medium bowl, combine the chickpeas and avocado.
Smash with a fork until well combined. It is all right if some
of the chickpeas are chunky, this will give the mixture
texture.

3. Stir in pesto and fresh lemon juice. Season with salt and
pepper, to taste.
4. Spread chickpea salad on bread slices and top with
spinach leaves, if using. Cut sandwich in half and serve!
5. Serve with cut up veggies, crackers, or pita chips. Enjoy!
